flounder.engine.implementation

Class IGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • flounder.engine.implementation.IGame

  • public abstract class IGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a game entry point for the engine to run from.

    • Method Detail

      • getFocusPosition

        public Vector3f getFocusPosition()
        Returns:
        The games focus position.

      • getFocusRotation

        public Vector3f getFocusRotation()
        Returns:
        The games focus rotation.

      • isGamePaused

        public boolean isGamePaused()
        Returns:
        Is the game currently paused?

      • getScreenBlur

        public float getScreenBlur()
        Returns:
        The current screen blur factor.

      • update

        public void update(Vector3f focusPosition,
                   Vector3f focusRotation,
                   boolean gamePaused,
                   float screenBlur)
        Updates the current engines game settings.
        Parameters:
        focusPosition - The position of the object the camera focuses on.
        focusRotation - The rotation of the object the camera focuses on.
        gamePaused - If game paused. Used to stop inputs to camera in menus.
        screenBlur - The factor (-1 to 1) by where the screen will be blurred from on the paused screen.

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Used to initialise the game, can be used to generate the world.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Used to update internal game objects and values. (call the updateGame method at the end of the function.

      • dispose

        public abstract void dispose()
        Cleans up all of the game objects. Should be called when the game closes.
